intro: Tetracera macphersonii, commonly known as the MacPherson's tetracera, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to Southeast Asia, particularly found in countries like Malaysia and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and produces small, clustered yellowish-green flowers. It typically grows in lowland rainforests and is often found in shaded, humid environments. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and less-studied species.
